abstract: United Nations says number of South Sudanese seeking refuge at its peacekeeping outposts is on rise, in sign of worsening conflict there; officials say new group of 4,500 South Sudanese have arrived at peacekeeping base in Upper Nile State, bringing total at base to 26,000 and total at all United Nations facilities to 115,000.
lead_paragraph: The movement of 4,500 South Sudanese to a peacekeeping base in Upper Nile State is indicative of increased instability in the nation, which continues to battle conflict and hunger.

headline.main: More South Sudanese Seek Shelter at U.N. Bases
headline.print_headline: More South Sudanese Seek Shelter at U.N. Bases

snippet: The movement of 4,500 South Sudanese to a peacekeeping base in Upper Nile State is indicative of increased instability in the nation, which continues to battle conflict and hunger.
